results.title: Small happiness : Life in a Chinese village (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Richard Gordon, Carma Hinton and Long Bow Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Long Bow Trilogy”.
Despite the tremendous advances women in China have made, serious problems continue. Long Bow women talk about love, marriage, work, birth control, birth customs and the now outlawed custom of foot binding. Truly moving interviews with a Long Bow woman and her mother-in-law draw us into their lives.

results.title: Small faces
results.creator_credit: Skyline Easterhouse Ltd (Glasgow), Billy MacKinnon, Steve Clark-Hall and Gillies MacKinnon
results.brief_description: Set in Glasgow in the late 1960’s, ‘Small faces’ is a gritty depiction of three working class brothers coming of age in an environment of gang warfare. The eldest, wayward Bobby is in the Glens, Alan, the artistic middle son is in love with the girl downstairs, and the youngest son Lex is creating the most cause for concern when he accidentally shoots the leader of the Tongs, mental Malky (Kevin McKidd), in the eye with an air rifle. The actions of Lex draw in Alan, the last of the MacLeans to be involved in the Glen/Tong animosity, setting a momentum they cannot control and forcing the brothers to question their loyalty between family and friends. Their story is set against a strong home environment, one in which their mother is acutely aware of their heritage and a time when things were better, yet also devoid of obvious male role models as Lex is torn between Alan and Bobby, and Bobby turning to the Glens without question. Cast includes Claire Higgins, Iain Robertson, Joseph McFadden and Laura Fraser.

results.title: Small claims tribunal
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: Follows the case of a consumer making a complaint to the Consumer Affairs Bureau about a dress that shrank after washing. The claim is subsequently settled before the Small Claims Tribunal. No other credits available

results.title: Small business: the company you keep
results.creator_credit: Tony Matthews, BBC-TV and Paul Ellis
results.brief_description: How to approach the problems of delegation, staff selection, and the future management of the company. As a business grows, those at the top must learn a new role. In addition to delegation, which is examined from several angles, there are important problems of communication and industrial relations.

results.title: Small body of still water
results.creator_credit: Don Murray, Film Australia and Dietmar Fill
results.brief_description: A pond is a small body of still water. Within this environment the life support elements of sun, water and oxygen enable the process of photosynthesis to take place, upon which much of the life in and around the pond is dependent.

results.title: Small boat safety: stowage, care and use of life-saving equipment
results.brief_description:
Demonstrates the do’s and don’ts of storing, caring and using life-saving equipment in small boats.
Suitable for upper secondary and tertiary levels.

results.title: Small boat safety
results.brief_description: The objective of this film is to increase recognition of small boat and pleasure craft hazards and to demonstrate sound safety practice to boating, water skiing, youth and community groups.
